Subsection 4.25.9 was retitled from Requests for Abatement, Claims for Refund, and Doubt as to Liability in Estate and Gift Tax Cases to Requests for Abatement, Claims for Refund, and Doubt as to Liability Offer in Compromise in Estate and Gift Tax Cases.

A new IRM 4.25.9.1 was added to comply with the new internal control requirements set forth in 1.11.2.2.5, IRM Standards, Address Management and Internal Controls. New subsections were added to provide the necessary background, authority, program objectives and review, terms/deﬁnitions/acronyms, and related resources required by IRM 1.11.2.2.5. The addition of the new IRM 4.25.9.1 resulted in the renumbering of all subsequent IRM subsections.

4.25.9.1, Distinguishing between a Request for Abatement, a Claim for Refund, and a Doubt as to Liability/Offer in Compromise in Estate and Gift Tax Cases, paragraphs (1) through (4) were moved to IRM 4.25.9.1.1, Background—Distinguishing between a Request for Abatement, a Claim for Refund, and a Doubt as to Liability/Offer in Compromise in Estate and Gift Tax Cases.

4.25.9.1, Distinguishing between a Request for Abatement, a Claim for Refund, and a Doubt as to Liability/Offer in Compromise in Estate and Gift Tax Cases, paragraphs (4) and (5) were moved to IRM 4.25.9.1.5, Related Resources paragraphs (2) and (3).

IRM 4.25.9.6, Doubt as to Liability and Offer in Compromise was retitled as Doubt as to Liability, Offer in Compromise. This IRM subsection was also revised extensively to remove outdated procedural content. IRM 4.25.9.6.1 through 4.25.9.6.7 were removed. Examiners are now directed to current examination procedures in IRMs 4.18.2, Doubt as to Liability. The OIC WSD Coordinator content was also removed. As a result of realigned responsibilities, the DATL Coordinator procedures no longer belong to Estate and Gift Tax Examination. Estate and Gift Workload Selection and Delivery’s IRM 4.25.3.9.2.6 contains the DATL Coordinator procedures.
Editorial changes have been made throughout this IRM. Website addresses, legal references, and IRM references were reviewed and updated as necessary.
